TopicTitle: Space Shuttles are off to the museums!

Articles.Content:
Most are already in the museums I believe. One did a low fly-by in NYC this morning/yesterday (not sure).

I\'m planning on driving there tonight/tomorrow. And by plan, I mean total spur of the moment.
Take pictures!

You guys up in NY got the Enterprise, the first shuttle but IIRC it never went to space. It had been down here near me at the Smithsonian\'s Udvar-Hazy center next to Dulles airport. I\'ve seen it a few times. Can\'t wait to see the new shuttle they just brought in.

The Udvar-Hazy is an awesome place. It basically holds things too big to put in the downtown DC National Air & Space museum. They\'ve got the Enola Gay and an SR-71 among other really cool stuff. It\'s awesome to get within a few feet of the SR-71. That thing is even *more* impressive up close.

Cheers!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

I really REALLY wanna go, but my other fear is that it\'s NYC.

I\'ve been there twice before, and both times it was quite unimpressive.

Insane traffic, dirty, icky, lots of people...

It\'s got some great things to check out (LIKE A FREAKIN SPACE SHUTTLE) but everything else about the place puts me on edge, like I\'m visiting a prison with no prison guards >_>

We\'ll see how this pans out. Biggest issue would be parking/driving
When I go to California in 4 weeks i am going to get to see a space shuttle in the museum!

No real space shuttle, but I have seen the Buran a year ago ;P (Technik Museum Speyer). There also is another museum like that (Technik Museum Sinsheim) with other cool stuff like Concorde and Tu-144 DIRECTLY behind each other...

One day, in the next few years, I am going to Cape Canaveral.

I don\'t even care if anyone comes with me... I am going.

One day, in the next few years, I am going to Cape Canaveral.

I don\'t even care if anyone comes with me... I am going.

i wnt to the cape twice over the last 5/6 years, and im in England couldn\'t go up to the launch pads as both time\'s shuttles were on the pad. the last time i wet it was i think either the second or third to last time one would fly.

Again, damn you all!

Oh well; this summer I\'m going to KSC (Kennedy, you fools!)

i wnt to the cape twice over the last 5/6 years, and im in England couldn\'t go up to the launch pads as both time\'s shuttles were on the pad. the last time i wet it was i think either the second or third to last time one would fly.

I\'m in England too... If I wasn\'t, I\'d probably have been already.

I will hopefully plan my trip to coincide with a launch (any launch, I don\'t really care what)...

When I go to California in 4 weeks i am going to get to see a space shuttle in the museum!

Won\'t it probably still be being prepared for display at that point?

Won\'t it probably still be being prepared for display at that point?

Way to crush the kid\'s dreams, bro.

Well I guess this is another reason to go to NYC...

Of course It takes like 2 hours to get there by car.

It would take us 2 and a half hours to get there by train.

New york isn\'t much different from my city.(Except the fact there\'s HUGE sky scrapers..)

I remember the last time I went to new york, I planned on seeing the construction of the new sky scrapers.

(Of course by then all they would have done is the basements...)

Ooh, two hours! How will you ever survive? =P

Yeah, listen. Anytime I wanna drive down to NY it takes me six.

Aight?

Ooh, two hours! How will you ever survive? =P

Yeah, listen. Anytime I wanna drive down to NY it takes me six.

Aight?

I\'m not complaining..

I wounder if they have wifi on the trains now...
Yeah NYC scares me too much to go alone, so I didn\'t make the trip
I saw ti take off when on hoilday *looks smug*

Thinking about those things just sitting about in museums for the rest of their existence makes me feel pretty sad tbh, at least I saw a Discovery launch.

(Was on a visit to Disneyland, and the shuttle-launch was the only thing that made that particular holiday bearable, everything else was so fake and cheesyâ€¦ The rest of my family decided to go shoe-shopping insteadâ€¦ I donâ€™t like my family much.)
Guh I wish I could have seen them launch. My goal in life is to see some launch from NASA. Anything really.

Guh I wish I could have seen them launch. My goal in life is to see some launch from NASA. Anything really.

Same.

My family plans on driving to disney land next year.

I serousily can not bear a day or two in a car with my sister without getting into a HUGE argument.

Ooh, two hours! How will you ever survive? =P

Aw boo hoo, 14 hours here, and I was on a bus. =P
